posts.name: Zachary Newkirk
posts.cooked:
This past year we used PathPlanner by @mjansen4857 for our path planning. I would definitely recommend it, you can look at his original post here . It worked wonderfully but I had some ideas for using other types of splines and other general improvements. So now that the season is over I have spent some time on it, thereâ€™s still lots to do, and would like to share it for anyway feedback or suggestions.

So far I have added the ability to use hermite splines and bÃ©zier curves as you choose, I havenâ€™t updated the java or C++ library to use the new system but will work on it soon. I have also added a log system for telemetry when running autons. Normally when you run it displays a graph that has a limited space, this works but for debugging or other purposes itâ€™s very limited, so now when you run it displays the same graph but you can also view the full graph afterwards. This system was just added and likely has a couple bugs I havenâ€™t ran into yet so please report any problems. This was my first time using flutter so any of the UI elements I added probably donâ€™t look to good, sorry about that, so suggestions or pointers would be appreciated.

The repo with my fork is here . I havenâ€™t updated any of the readme or the release files so to run my modified version you need to run the main.dart file in the lib folder. Iâ€™ll work on updating these soon. Again these were just some ideas I had a worked on for 2 days so if you have any other ideas or find any bugs Iâ€™d love to hear about them.

posts.name: Fletch
posts.cooked: Welcome to the world of open source! You should definitely consider opening a pull request to contribute back to the original project.

posts.name: Zachary Newkirk
posts.cooked: I would love to contribute back but I donâ€™t think I can create a pull request on the original repo without write permissions unfortunately.

posts.name: Dan Katzuv
posts.cooked: You should be able to open a pull request from your fork back to the main repository.

posts.name: Fletch
posts.cooked: If you have a fork, you absolutely can!

posts.name: Michael Jansen
posts.cooked:
Anyone can create pull requests to public projects. It allows you to suggest merging changes from your fork into the original.

Just as a heads up though, I likely wonâ€™t accept a PR for the graph change as it sort of overlaps with what AdvantageScope is good for, which Iâ€™m trying to avoid. It just makes things harder to maintain. I kind of want to remove the telemetry page entirely and just suggest the use of AdvantageScope, but weâ€™ll see.

posts.name: Zachary Newkirk
posts.cooked: Cool Iâ€™ll definitely do that. The work on the telemetry page was more a personal use because I havenâ€™t used advantageScope but it was something I was going to look into before next season, thanks for the heads up.
